nodes.text: Luona was a female alive in the year 0 ABY.

After meeting an individual in a bar, Luona had sent 57 messages to the person's rented quarters on the space station StarForge Station by the following week. Due to this, the individual left and joined the crew of the EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate Far Orbit, a privateering vessel working for the Alliance to Restore the Republic after many of the ship's personnel mutinied from under the Galactic Empire's control, when the frigate docked at the station looking for crew.

Luona was first mentioned in Preparing for War, an adventure scenario in 1998's The Far Orbit Project, by Timothy S. O'Brien. The book was a supplement to West End Games's Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game and had the same theme of the previous publication Pirates & Privateers, as the supplement followed the privateering vessel Far Orbit. She was mentioned under the heading titled "Avoiding a social misunderstanding," which was part of a section that gave examples of reasons those players who had non-mutineer characters could have for leaving StarForge Station.
